title: Operation Sindoor: Army videos show how India destroyed Pakistan terror camps
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people, the Indian Army launched "Operation Sindoor," targeting nine terrorist locations in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir. The strikes, executed with precision, aimed at dismantling critical infrastructure belonging to terror groups like LeT, JeM, and Hizbul Mujahideen.

title: 12 dead in Pakistan shelling across LoC, J&K's Poonch worst hit
content: Pakistani Army's shelling in Jammu and Kashmir's border areas, including the Line of Control, resulted in at least 12 fatalities, including four children, and 57 injuries. Poonch district was the worst hit. This occurred after Indian forces struck terrorist sites in Pakistan and PoK under "Operation Sindoor." Indian Army retaliated, causing significant damage to Pakistani posts.

title: Anand Mahindra on Operation Sindoor: Our prayers are with ...
content: Following the launch of Operation Sindoor by the Indian government, Anand Mahindra, Chairman of Mahindra Group, voiced his support for the Indian Armed Forces. He conveyed a message of solidarity on Twitter, emphasizing national unity. Operation Sindoor targeted terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir in response to the Pahalgam terrorist attack.

title: ‚ÄòReady to strike‚Äô: Army posted video moments before launching Op Sindoor
content: The Indian Army released a powerful video showcasing its capabilities just before launching Operation Sindoor, targeting nine terror locations in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir. This swift action followed the video release and was a direct response to the deadly terror attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir, where 26 innocent lives were tragically lost on April 22.

title: Microsoft HR now 'bans' employees who are ‚Ä¶
content: Microsoft is implementing a two-year rehire ban for underperforming employees and tracking "good attrition," signaling a stricter management approach. This policy shift, revealed in internal documents, mirrors similar practices at other tech giants like Amazon and Meta. The company is also offering struggling employees a separation package as an alternative to performance improvement plans.

title: 'Picture abhi baki hai': Former Indian Army chief drops cryptic post
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India executed Operation Sindoor, targeting nine terror camps across Pakistan and PoK linked to JeM, LeT, and HM. The strikes, a response to the killing of 26 civilians, aimed to dismantle key terror infrastructures. The operation targeted facilities like Markaz Subhan Allah and Markaz Taiba, crucial training and operational hubs.

title: 'Nasty fasty': Jos Buttler plays gully cricket in the streets of Mumbai
content: Jos Buttler, the Gujarat Titans' star, delighted Mumbai fans by playing street cricket with local kids, sharing the heartwarming moments on social media. Buttler's impressive IPL 2025 performance includes 500 runs in 11 matches, averaging 71.43, as the Gujarat Titans secured a top spot after defeating Mumbai Indians, enhancing their playoff chances.

title: Musk is no longer ‚ÄòElon Musk‚Äô on Twitter; changes his profile name to‚Ä¶
content: Elon Musk has once again altered his X display name, this time to 'Gorklon Rust,' sparking speculation about its meaning. The moniker appears to blend references to Grok, Musk's AI chatbot, and the Rust programming language, potentially linked to xAI's infrastructure.

title: Operation Sindoor: PBKS vs MI match could be moved out of Dharamsala
content: While Punjab Kings (PBKS) and Delhi Capitals (DC) are already there for their match on May 8, Mumbai Indians (MI) were scheduled to reach later this week. Now with Dharamsala airport, and neighbouring Amritsar and Chandigarh airports shut, the teams and the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) would look to swing a plan in action.

title: Operation Sindoor: Full list of 9 terror sites targeted by Indian Army in Pakistan, PoK
content: Under 'Operation Sindoor,' the Indian Armed Forces targeted nine terror facilities linked to Jaish-e-Mohammed, Lashkar-e-Taiba, and Hizbul Mujahideen in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. These strikes, conducted after the Pahalgam massacre, aimed to dismantle terrorist infrastructure used for planning attacks against India. The targeted locations included Markaz Subhan Allah in Bahawalpur and Syedna Bilal Camp in Muzaffarabad.

title: Inside Operation Sindoor: How India carried out precision strikes on Pak
content: In a retaliatory move for the Pahalgam terror attack, India launched "Operation Sindoor," executing precision strikes on nine terrorist bases across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: Operation Sindoor: 20 airports closed till Saturday morning
content: Following India's strike on terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and PoK, civilian flights were suspended at 20 airports in north and western India until May 10, 2025. Airlines, including IndiGo and Air India, cancelled flights to affected destinations, offering refunds and rescheduling options. Furthermore, many foreign airlines ceased overflying Pakistani airspace, leading to longer flight times and some cancellations.

title: IPL 2025: KKR players to wear special kit at training before CSK game
content: The Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) are celebrating extraordinary women through their Shahoshi Rani initiative during the IPL 2025 season. Forty women, recognized for their bravery and resilience, will attend KKR's practice session and interact with players and co-owner Juhi Chawla.

title: 25 minutes, 9 terror camps, at least 70 terrorists: How Army executed Operation Sindoor
content: Indian armed forces executed 'Operation Sindoor', dismantling nine terrorist camps in Pakistan and PoK in a swift 25-minute operation. Foreign Secretary Misri cited the Pahalgam attack as the impetus, emphasizing the need to deter further cross-border terrorism. Colonel Qureshi detailed the targeted sites, while Wing Commander Singh highlighted the strategic rationale and precision of the operation, ensuring minimal civilian impact.

title: Watch: It was focused and precise: India on strikes on terror targets in Pakistan | Operation Sindoor
content: India added it has credible leads and evidence pointing towards the clear involvement of Pakistan-based terrorists in the Pahalgam attack

title: No need for violence on Waqf Act as it will never be implemented in West Bengal, says Mamata
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari traded charges on the Murshidabad riots

title: Suryakumar Yadav breaks Sachin Tendulkar's iconic IPL record
content: Suryakumar Yadav has distinguished himself in Mumbai Indians' history, achieving three IPL seasons with over 500 runs, surpassing Sachin Tendulkar and Quinton de Kock. This milestone was reached during a match against Gujarat Titans, where he scored 35 runs. Suryakumar now tops the IPL 2025 run charts with 510 runs in 12 matches, averaging 63.75 with a strike rate exceeding 170. He has scored three fifties this season, with a best of 67*.

title: Op Sindoor: 10 family members, 4 aides of Masood Azhar killed in Indian strikes
content: Jaish-e-Mohammad chief Azhar Masood reported the deaths of ten family members and four associates in 'Operation Sindoor,' conducted by the Indian Army. The strikes targeted a Jaish-e-Mohammed training center in Bahawalpur, Pakistan, following the Pahalgam terrorist attack that killed 25 Indians and one Nepali citizen. The Indian Army targeted nine terrorist bases across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied-Kashmir.

title: 'Fateh moment': Mohammed Shami hails Indian army's 'Operation Sindoor'
content: Indian speedster Mohammed Shami and several other cricketers have lauded the armed forces for "Operation Sindoor," a response to the Pahalgam terror attack. The Indian Air Force precisely struck nine terror launchpads across Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir without breaching Pakistani airspace. Gautam Gambhir, Harbhajan Singh, and others voiced strong support, emphasizing the operation's strategic precision and India's commitment to counter-terrorism.

title: Connor McDavid's wife Lauren Kyle flaunts her expensive lifestyle hours
content: Lauren Kyle, wife of Connor McDavid, shared glimpses of her luxurious life on social media, including her Porsche, diamond ring, and moments with friends. The posts came as McDavid and the Oilers focus on the playoffs against the Golden Knights. McDavid credited his teammates, particularly Pickard and Brown, for their recent win against the Kings.

title: Did Pakistan shoot down Rafale jet during Operation Sindoor? PIB fact check says no
content: Following Indian Army's 'Operation Sindoor' targeting terror camps in Pakistan and PoK, Pakistani media and social platforms spread false claims of retaliatory strikes. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) debunked these claims, including alleged attacks on Srinagar Airbase and downing of an Indian Rafale jet.

title: Pakistan shuts airspace for 48 hours; several Asian airlines avoid route
content: Following India's Operation Sindoor targeting terror locations, Pakistan initially shut down its airspace for 48 hours, causing widespread flight disruptions and diversions. While restrictions were briefly lifted, Lahore's airspace faced another closure. Numerous international carriers rerouted flights.

title: Sehwag reacts on 'Operation Sindoor': 'Agar koi aap par patthar ... '
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India launched "Operation Sindoor" on May 7, targeting terror launchpads across Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir. Virender Sehwag and other prominent cricketers, including Gautam Gambhir and Harbhajan Singh, lauded the armed forces' precise execution. The operation, which strategically avoided breaching Pakistani airspace, targeted infrastructure of banned groups, conveying a strong message of accountable counter-terrorism.

title: Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia: ‚ÄòIn the US, Teachers don‚Äôt correct mistakes, they value‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia criticizes India's education system for prioritizing rote learning and obedience over critical thinking and creativity. He argues that the system produces conformist individuals ill-equipped for innovation, unlike the West, where children are encouraged to express ideas freely. Bhatia believes this stifles entrepreneurial spirit and perpetuates a fear of failure, hindering India's progress.

title: HAMMER & SCALP: Weapons India used to target terror sites in Pak, PoK
content: India launched Operation Sindoor, targeting terror camps in Pakistan and PoK in retaliation for the Pahalgam attack. The operation destroyed multiple LeT and JeM training facilities, hitting nine sites with precision weaponry. Indian forces used SCALP cruise missiles, HAMMER precision-guided bombs, and loitering munitions, avoiding engagement with Pakistani military installations. The mission was described as focused, measured, and non-escalatory.

title: Kartarpur corridor shut after Operation Sindoor
content: The Kartarpur corridor in Punjab's Gurdaspur was reportedly shut on Wednesday following India‚Äôs precision missile strikes on nine terror camps in Pakistan and PoK under Operation Sindoor. The strikes came two weeks after the Pahalgam terror attack. The corridor, opened in 2019 for visa-free pilgrimage, typically allows up to 5,000 Indian pilgrims daily to visit Kartarpur.

title: Airports shut, flights cancelled: How Op Sindoor impacted air travel in north India
content: Following Operation Sindoor, several airlines have suspended air travel to northern India due to airport closures and airspace restrictions. IndiGo cancelled approximately 160 domestic flights, impacting services to high-alert zones. Air India, Alliance Air, SpiceJet, Air India Express, and Akasa Air also cancelled or rerouted flights, offering refunds and rescheduling options to affected passengers.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos loses World's Second-Richest man title to....
content: Mark Zuckerberg's fortune has surged past Jeff Bezos, making him the world's second-richest person, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. This shift occurred as Meta's shares outperformed Amazon's, with Meta reporting strong first-quarter revenue. Meanwhile, Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual, boosted by increased Tesla shares following his commitment to reduce time spent on government duties.

title: Operation Sindoor impact: Why Nifty, Sensex are unlikely to be hit too much
content: Operation Sindoor impact: Despite Indo-Pak military tensions, Indian markets have historically shown resilience, with the Nifty 50 experiencing modest declines followed by strong recoveries. Operation Sindoor had minimal impact, as markets focus on economic fundamentals and capital flows.

title: Over 15 Maoists gunned down in ‚Äòbiggest ever‚Äô operation in Chhattisgarh's Bastar
content: A major anti-Maoist operation, 'Operation Sankalp,' launched on April 21 in the Bijapur district of Chhattisgarh, has resulted in the killing of more than 15 Maoists on Wednesday, bringing the total recovered bodies to 19. Security forces, including DRG, STF, CoBRA, and CRPF, have been targeting Maoist strongholds, destroying hideouts, and recovering explosives.

title: 'Targets chosen on credible intel': Govt shares details of 'Operation Sindoor'
content: Following the Pahalgam terrorist attack that killed 25 Indians and one Nepali citizen, India launched 'Operation Sindoor,' targeting nine terrorist camps across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Foreign Secretary Misri cited intelligence of impending attacks, justifying the strikes as a necessary deterrent.

title: Govt releases footage of Army bombing terror camps in Pakistan & PoK
content: The Indian Armed Forces announced "Operation Sindoor," targeting Lashkar-e-Taiba and Jaish-e-Mohammed terror camps in Pakistan and PoJK. Colonel Sofiya Qureshi presented video evidence of successful strikes on terror camps, clarifying that no military installations were targeted and no civilian casualties were reported.

title: Operation Sindoor: Why these 9 terror hideouts were chosen by the Army
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam attack, the Indian Army and IAF launched 'Operation Sindoor,' destroying nine terror hideouts linked to JeM, LeT, and Hizbul Mujahideen in Pakistan and PoK. The strikes targeted key training and operational centers, including Markaz Subhan Allah and Markaz Taiba, used for indoctrination, training, and planning attacks like the Pulwama bombing.

title: India launches ‚ÄòOperation Sindoor‚Äô, conducts strikes against terror infrastructure in Pakistan, PoK
content: No Pakistani military facilities have been targeted, government statement says; Army‚Äôs official X handle posts: ‚ÄúJustice is Served. Jai Hind‚Äù

title: Punjab CM Mann trying to create differences among people, says Haryana CM Saini
content: Mr. Saini has also alleged that the AAP government in Punjab is failing its electoral base of farmers, and will face defeat in next Punjab elections

title: 10-year-old dies due to diarrhoea in Sri Sathya Sai district in A.P.
content: Another 23 people from Gollahatti village in the district are also affected, and 10 have been admitted to hospitals, according to sources

title: Who is Wing Commander Vyomika Singh, IAF chopper pilot at 'Operation Sindoor' briefing
content: Wing Commander Vyomika Singh jointly led the media briefing on 'Operation Sindoor,' India's retaliatory strike on terror camps in Pakistan and PoK, following the Pahalgam massacre. The operation targeted and destroyed nine terror hideouts, including camps linked to the 26/11 attacks.

title: Adnan Sami lauds ‚ÄòOperation Sindoor‚Äô takes dig at Pakistani news anchors
content: Adnan Sami, the singer, has voiced support for 'Operation Sindoor'. This operation targeted terrorist camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Several Bollywood figures, including Kangana Ranaut and Akshay Kumar, have also praised the Indian Armed Forces. The Ministry of Defence stated that the operation was a response to the Pahalgam terrorist attack.

title: Who's Col Sofiya Qureshi? Army officer who briefed world on 'Operation Sindoor'
content: Wing Commander Vyomika Singh and Colonel Sofiya Qureshi briefed the media on Operation Sindoor, India's decisive response to the Pahalgam terror attack. The operation targeted and destroyed nine terror hideouts in Pakistan and PoK, focusing on Jaish-e-Mohammed, Lashkar-e-Taiba, and Hizbul Mujahideen. Col Qureshi, known for her leadership in multinational exercises and peacekeeping missions, exemplifies India's commitment to women in military roles.

title: 'It is a crime': Hardik Pandya loses his cool
content: Mumbai Indians faced a narrow defeat against Gujarat Titans, with captain Hardik Pandya lamenting the costly no-balls bowled by the team. Despite a spirited bowling performance led by Jasprit Bumrah and Trent Boult, MI fell short while defending a sub-par total of 155/8. Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya described the no-balls bowled by him and his teammates as a "crime" following their three-wicket defeat via the DLS method against Gujarat Titans in a thrilling contest at the Wankhede Stadium.

title: Operation Sindoor vs Balakot: India raises the stakes with deep strikes in Pakistan
content: Indian armed forces executed Operation Sindoor, targeting terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir. This action avenged the Pahalgam terror attack. Strikes hit JeM and LeT headquarters, plus Hizbul Mujahideen sites. India used precision munitions and loitering drones. The operation aimed to dismantle terror infrastructure. It signifies a major escalation beyond previous cross-border actions.

title: Sachin Tendulkar reacts to 'Operation Sindoor': ‚ÄòNo room for terrorism‚Äô
content: Sachin Tendulkar and other cricketers applaud Operation Sindoor. The operation retaliated against the Pahalgam terror attack. Indian Air Force targeted terror launchpads in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. The strikes focused on Jaish-e-Mohammed and Lashkar-e-Taiba infrastructure. Defence officials confirm targets were carefully selected. It reinforces India‚Äôs counter-terrorism policy. Operation Sindoor sparks national unity.

title: Shoaib Ibrahim reacts to rumours of Dipika Kakar's Label DKI shutting down
content: Dipika Kakar and Shoaib Ibrahim's ethnic apparel brand, Label DKI, faced rumors of shutting down, which Shoaib addressed in an Instagram Q&A. He clarified that the brand is not closing but experiencing delays in new stock. Shoaib also mentioned considering a discount sale on existing stock before launching fresh designs, dismissing the fake news circulating about the brand's closure.

title: NBA conference semifinals: Haliburton drills last-second 3-pointer to stun Cavs in Game 2
content: Indiana Pacers beat the no. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers 121-112 on tuesday night . Golden State defeated the No. 6-seeded Minnesota Timberwolves 99-88 . the 4-seed Denver Nuggets toppled the Oklahoma City Thunder in the West after a fourth quarter surge .

title: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: India Unleashes Missiles On Lashkar, Jaish Terror Camps In Historic Operation
content: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: The Indian armed forces early Wednesday carried out 24 precision missile strikes on nine terror targets in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK), including Muridke and Bahawalpur.

title: 10% Of World's Richest Have Higher Carbon Footprint Than Poorest 50%: Study
content: Ten per cent of the world's richest individuals have a higher carbon footprint than the poorest 50 per cent, leading to climate extremes such as heat waves and droughts, according to a study on Wednesday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | How 'Precision Planning' Defined India's Operation Sindoor
content: By coupling military precision with diplomatic and economic measures, including the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, India has positioned itself to inflict maximum damage on Pakistan's terror ecosystem and its broader strategic interests.

title: NIA Urges People To Share Photos, Videos Related To Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Wednesday appealed to all tourists, visitors and local people who might have any more information, photographs or videos relating to the Pahalgam terror attack to immediately contact it.

title: "Patriotism Runs In Our Blood": Family Of Colonel Who Led Op With Wing Commander
content: As Colonel Sofiya Qureshi and Wing Commander Vyomika Singh flanked Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri on Wednesday morning during the briefing about Operation Sindoor, creating a striking image, her family in Gujarat beamed with pride.

title: Pak Terror Bases Were Hit Twice During Operation Sindoor, Say Sources. Here's How
content: Pakistan's terrorist bases were hit twice during the armed forces' post-midnight "Operation Sindoor" today, sources have said.

title: Ex-UK PM Rishi Sunak Supports India Over Operation Sindoor, Says "Justified"
content: Rishi Sunak earlier had condemned the "barbaric" attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam in which 26 people were killed.

title: Mock Drill At Mumbai's Cross Maidan Simulates Air Strike Scenario
content: At exactly 4 PM, a siren blared at Cross Maidan in south Mumbai, setting off a flurry of activity as part of a mock drill simulating an air strike involving teams of civil defence, fire brigade, and paramedics who rushed to save the "injured".

title: "Verify Facts": India Slams Chinese State Media Over Op Sindoor "Disinformation"
content: India has strongly criticised Chinese state media Global Times for spreading disinformation to mislead the public on India's cruise missile strikes at terror infrastructure deep inside Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (POK).

title: Opinion: Opinion | Operation Sindoor: What Can India Expect From The World's Reactions?
content: There is a clear concern within the international community about the potential for the situation to escalate, especially given that both nations are nuclear-armed.

title: "Don't End It Here": Wife Of Navy Officer Killed In Pahalgam On Operation Sindoor
content: Himanshi Narwal, wife of Navy officer Lieutenant Vinay Narwal, who was killed in the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, requested the Centre not to end the operation and make sure it is the "start of the end of terrorism".

content: Nine terrorist camps linked to groups like Jaish-e-Mohammad, Lashkar-e-Taiba and Hizbul Mujahideen were destroyed under 'Operation Sindoor' to avenge the Pahalgam attack.

content: The airspace in India's western region along the border with Pakistan is no longer available for commercial flights, reports said.

content: National Security Advisor Ajit Doval on Wednesday told his counterparts in various countries that India has no intent to escalate tensions but is prepared to "retaliate resolutely" if Pakistan does so, officials said.

title: CBI Director Praveen Sood Gets One Year's Extension
content: Praveen Sood took over as the CBI director on may 25, 2023 . decision to extend his tenure was taken in a meeting of the selection committee . he is a 1986-batch Indian police service officer of the Karnataka cadre .
